titleStmt.title: A northern blast, or the spiritual Quaker converted: being soul-saving advice to the giddy people of England, who are running headlong to destruction. Wherein is shewed the manner of their meetings, in the county of Yorkshire, and Durham, their quakings, skreekings [sic] and ridiculous actions; also their fond and false restings of the scriptures. With a full examination, conviction of their tenets. / By G. Emmot, of Durham gent. formerly a brother amongst them, but now (by the help of God) converted, and established in the truth.
titleStmt.author: Emmot, George.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for R. Lambert, Bookseller at the Ministers Gate in York,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "Febr. 14 1654"; the final 5 in the imprint date crossed out.
E714A is a copy of this which lacks prelims. If E714aA uses the same sheets as this, E714A matches that as well.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
